[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Trait: KVStorage backup] If KVStorage is backed up, are private keys properly protected in backups, or can backup compromise leak all validator keys? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Error: KeyNotSet vs KeyVersionNotFound] Can confusion between KeyNotSet and KeyVersionNotFound errors cause incorrect fallback behavior in key lookup logic? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Error: SerializationError] If signing fails with SerializationError, is sensitive message data logged in the error, potentially leaking validator consensus votes or proposals? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Error: Panic on unwrap] Does any code path have implicit unwrap() or expect() calls that could panic on error, crashing the validator node? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Error: Error propagation] Are all errors properly propagated, or can silent failures cause keys to not be saved while the operation appears to succeed? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Memory: Private key copying] Are Ed25519PrivateKey instances cloned multiple times unnecessarily, increasing the attack surface for memory disclosure attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Memory: Stack vs heap] Are private keys stored on the stack where they could be easier to recover from core dumps, or are they heap-allocated and zeroed? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Memory: Secure deletion] When keys are rotated or deleted, is the memory immediately zeroed, or can old key material persist in memory until overwritten? (High)
[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Memory: Debug output] Can Debug trait implementations accidentally log private keys to stdout/stderr during error scenarios? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Trait: CryptoKVStorage blanket impl] Does the blanket implementation 'impl<T: CryptoKVStorage> CryptoStorage for T' allow unintended types to implement CryptoStorage, bypassing security checks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Trait: CryptoKVStorage marker trait] Since CryptoKVStorage is an empty marker trait, can any KVStorage implementation be used without proper security validation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Type: Ed25519PrivateKey serialization] Is Ed25519PrivateKey serialization/deserialization from KVStorage properly validated, or can malformed data be deserialized into invalid keys? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Crypto: Ed25519 implementation] Does the underlying Ed25519 implementation properly validate signatures and prevent weak key attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Crypto: Key reuse] Can the same private key be used for multiple purposes (consensus signing, transaction signing), enabling cross-protocol attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Crypto: Signature algorithm binding] Are signatures bound to Ed25519 algorithm, or could algorithm substitution attacks cause verification with wrong algorithm? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Crypto: Hash function] Does CryptoHash trait use a collision-resistant hash function, or can hash collisions enable signature reuse across different messages? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Concurrency: Mutable reference] Does &mut self in create_key(), import_private_key(), and rotate_key() provide sufficient synchronization for concurrent access? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Concurrency: Read-write races] Can concurrent sign() (read-only &self) and rotate_key() (&mut self) cause data races if KVStorage doesn't provide internal synchronization? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Concurrency: Lock ordering] If multiple keys are accessed concurrently, can deadlocks occur in the underlying KVStorage implementation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Concurrency: Thread safety] Is the CryptoStorage trait implementation Send/Sync safe, or can it be used from multiple threads unsafely? (High)
[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [State: Key version consistency] Can the current key and previous_version key become out of sync such that version chain is broken? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [State: Orphaned previous versions] After multiple rotations, can orphaned previous_version entries accumulate without cleanup, wasting storage? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [State: Missing key detection] If a key is corrupted or deleted externally, is this detected before attempting to sign, or can it cause validator failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Validator: Consensus key compromise] If a Byzantine validator compromises another validator's consensus key via KVStorage access, can they forge blocks and break AptosBFT safety? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Validator: Key rotation timing attack] Can an attacker force key rotation at critical consensus moments to cause signature verification failures and validator ejection? (High)
